text.p: The following are top headlines from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
THE GLOBE AND MAIL: Hydro fiasco to cost billions: 'Chickens are coming home to roost,' Harris says after report cites management meltdown.
Hydro fallout may hit Candus: Reactor sales could suffer.
Partition haunts India's celebration: On Aug. 15, 1947, Britain's colony gained its freedom, but lost its unity. Now it's rethinking the divide.
Montfort Hospital to remain open: Ambulatory care to replace full service.
Nutrition experts unveil new rules for eating well: Report revamps view of vitamin, mineral requirements.
Report on Business Section: CP Ships boosts global presence: Courtship purchase will double revenue to $2-billion as industry consolidation continues.
Repap founder Petty forced to resign: Funds clean out boardroom bid to turn firm around.
Balm rides into the sunset: The goal of Fracmaster's maverick chairman in selling his stake on the open market is to keep the company independent.
Novopharm turning sights on cancer, AIDS drugs: Sees future in brand name medicines.
THE FINANCIAL POST: More mega deals keep oilpatch hopping.
Repap owners clean up: Founder George Petty ousted as new shareholders set to work to build value.
